movesets.name: Chlorophyll Sweeper

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

Oddish's most powerful attack is Solar Beam, which hits without charging in the sun. It heavily damages anything that doesn't resist it, though it is less reliable than Giga Drain, which hits regardless of whether or not the sun is up, albeit for less power. Sludge Bomb nails Grass- and Fairy-type Pokemon, particularly Cottonee and Spritzee. Hidden Power Fire covers the Steel-types that Solar Beam and Sludge Bomb fail to hit, including Pawniard, Magnemite and Ferroseed. Sleep Powder incapacitates a foe too bulky for Oddish to deal with. It's also useful for bringing back the sun by giving Vulpix a free turn to switch in.

Set Details

In order for Oddish to sweep effectively, it needs 240 Special Attack EVs. A Life Orb makes its attacks hit extremely hard. 200 Speed EVs with a Timid nature allow it to outspeed Choice Scarf users such as Pawniard and Drilbur under the sun.

Usage Tips

Without Eviolite, Oddish is too frail to be switched in, especially if it has racked up residual damage from entry hazards and Life Orb recoil, so it should only be brought in on a Grass- or Water-type attack. Oddish should attempt to sweep late-game once its counters are removed, but it can also force switches and put heavy dents in opponents in order for a teammate to finish them off late-game. However, Oddish isn't useful if the sun isn't up, so if the sun is about to end, it can use Sleep Powder on an opponent so that Vulpix can come back in and set up the sun.

Team Options

Oddish needs a teammate to set up the sun, and Drought Vulpix is the best choice. In addition, other Chlorophyll users such as Bulbasaur and Bellsprout can be considered as teammates, as they can help break down opposing teams. Eviolite Chinchou and Archen are helpful with removing the Fire- and Flying-types Oddish can't take on and can even provide a safe switch-in for Oddish with a slow Volt Switch or U-turn. Drilbur can provide Rapid Spin support, which is quite helpful for Oddish, as damage from Life Orb and entry hazards will wear it down very quickly. A Steel-type such as Magnemite or Pawniard can reliably check Oddish's Flying-type counters such as Vullaby and Fletchling. Oddish enjoys having entry hazards of its own to wear down its bulkier opponents. Dwebble and Archen both can set them up, while Archen can also provide Defog support and reliably check other Flying-types such as Vullaby and Fletchling.

movesets.name: Eviolite

items.name: Eviolite
items.description: Boosts Defense and Special Defense of holder by 50% if it is an NFE Pokemon.

movesets.description:
Moves

Oddish's most powerful STAB option is Solar Beam. Although Giga Drain is weaker, it's a useful alternative, as it ensures Oddish isn't left waiting a turn to charge if the sun runs out or the weather is changed by an opposing weather inducer. Sludge Bomb is a reliable STAB that nails Grass- and Fairy-types, particularly Cottonee and Spritzee, for super effective damage. Hidden Power Fire is mostly for hitting Steel-types that resist Oddish's STAB moves, including Pawniard, Magnemite, and Ferroseed, for super effective damage. Sleep Powder is useful for incapacitating a foe Oddish can't push past, or for helping Vulpix bring back the sun if it is about to be cut short. It can also be used to incapacitate Sucker Punch users such as Pawniard.

Set Details

Oddish is the bulkiest Chlorophyll sweeper in the tier and is even bulkier with Eviolite. For instance, with 76 Defense EVs, it can take an itemless Acrobatics from Fletchling and avoid a OHKO all but 6.3% of the time. Oddish needs 160 Special Attack EVs with a Modest nature for its attacks to hit hard, as well as 200 Speed EVs with Chlorophyll in order to outspeed all unboosted threats in the sun. This also allows it to outspeed Choice Scarf users such as Chinchou and Magnemite and Speed tie with others such as Pawniard and Drilbur.

Usage Tips

With Eviolite, Oddish is quite bulky and can therefore switch in more easily than other Chlorophyll users. It can switch into common threats such as Cottonee, Croagunk, Timburr, Mienfoo, and Chinchou quite comfortably and start attacking from there. Oddish should be brought in whenever the sun is up to put heavy offensive pressure on an opponent or to simply sweep once threats such as Vullaby and Fletchling are taken out. Sleep Powder can be used so Oddish has time to switch out and get its sun back if it is about to run out. It can also cripple a threat that Oddish is unable to beat.

Team Options

Vulpix is an important teammate for Oddish, as it sets up the sun that the latter requires to sweep. Another Chlorophyll user such as Bellsprout or Bulbasaur can be considered in order to overwhelm an opponent with offensive pressure; however, this puts even more pressure on the team's Flying-type checks to do their job. Archen is able to check Oddish's deadliest counters, including Flying- and Fire-types. It's also capable of providing support by removing entry hazards as well as setting up its own, which is very welcome for this set, as Eviolite Oddish lacks the power it would have with Life Orb, and thus appreciates having walls worn down. Steel-type teammates such as Magnemite and Pawniard are able to check Flying-types such as Vullaby and Archen. They also resist the Ice- and Psychic-type moves Oddish is weak to, while Oddish is bulky enough to come in on the Fighting-type moves they are weak to. A teammate to remove hazards, such as Drilbur or the aforementioned Archen, is important as well, as although Oddish may be bulky, it cannot take hits so easily if it has taken too much entry hazard damage.

moves.name: Absorb
moves.description: Leeches 50% damage.

moves.name: Acid
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: After You
moves.description: The target will attack immediately after the user in the same turn.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Bullet Seed
moves.description: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Charm
moves.description: Lowers foe's Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Cut
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Dazzling Gleam
moves.description: Deals damage to all adjacent foes.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Energy Ball
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Flail
moves.description: Does more damage as HP decreases.

moves.name: Flash
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy 1 stage.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Gastro Acid
moves.description: Nullifies the foe's ability.

moves.name: Giga Drain
moves.description: Leeches 50% damage.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Grassy Terrain
moves.description: For five turns, Pokemon on the ground restore 1/16 of their HP each turn. Their Grass-type moves are powered up by 50%.

moves.name: Infestation
moves.description: Traps and damages target for 4-5 turns.

moves.name: Ingrain
moves.description: Heals the user 1/16 its max HP each turn. Prevents the user from switching.

moves.name: Leech Seed
moves.description: Leeches 1/8 of the target's HP each turn.

moves.name: Lucky Chant
moves.description: Blocks critical hits for 5 turns.

moves.name: Mega Drain
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Moonlight
moves.description: Heals variably depending on the weather.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Nature Power
moves.description: Attack changes based on terrain.

moves.name: Petal Dance
moves.description: Repeats for 2-3 turns. Confuses the user at the end.

moves.name: Poison Powder
moves.description: Poisons the target.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Razor Leaf
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Seed Bomb
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Sleep Powder
moves.description: Puts the target to sleep.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Sludge Bomb
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Solar Beam
moves.description: Charges up turn 1; attacks on turn 2.

moves.name: Stun Spore
moves.description: Paralyzes the target.

moves.name: Substitute

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.description: Lowers evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Swords Dance
moves.description: Boosts Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Synthesis

moves.name: Teeter Dance
moves.description: Confuses all other active Pokemon.

moves.name: Tickle
moves.description: Lowers Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Venoshock
moves.description: Hits poisoned targets with double Base Power.

moves.name: Worry Seed
moves.description: Changes the foe's ability to Insomnia.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Increases the chance of successfully escaping battle with a wild Pokemon.
